function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential spread of SARS-CoV-2 in sewage samples","Impact":"Uncontrolled spread can lead to contamination of water sources and potential infection of individuals in contact with the water","Mitigation":"Implement strict guidelines for handling and processing sewage samples to prevent the spread of the virus","Technologies":"Use of digital droplet PCR for accurate quantification and detection of SARS-CoV-2 in sewage samples","People":"Laboratory workers, sewage treatment plant operators, public health officials","Owner":"Public health authorities, sewage treatment facilities, research institutions"},{"Description":"Inconsistent quantification of SARS-CoV-2 in sewage samples","Impact":"Inaccurate quantification can lead to misinterpretation of the level of virus presence in the sewage, impacting public health decisions and interventions","Mitigation":"Regular calibration and validation of quantification methods, use of reference materials for qRT-PCR quantification","Technologies":"Reference materials for qRT-PCR quantification, digital droplet PCR","People":"Laboratory technicians, public health researchers, decision-makers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health authorities, laboratories"},{"Description":"Variability in sensitivity of primer/probe sets for SARS-CoV-2 RNA detection","Impact":"Differences in assay sensitivity can result in inconsistent detection of the virus, impacting the accuracy of surveillance and monitoring efforts","Mitigation":"Utilize multiple primer/probe sets and compare results to ensure accuracy, follow FDA guidelines on primer/probe set sensitivity","Technologies":"Use of multiple primer/probe sets, comparison of results using different sets, adherence to FDA guidelines","People":"Laboratory technicians, public health researchers, decision-makers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health authorities, laboratories"}]}
